[@id:230948]
[%Nr. 4464]
[!Verneine die vorgegebenen Sätze.]
===
1. We are from Nigeria.
[$We are not from Nigeria.][@shortAnswer]
===
2.They hate fish.
[$They do not hate fish.][@shortAnswer]
===
3. She wants to become a superstar.
[$She does not want to become a superstar.][@shortAnswer]
===
4.The sun goes around the earth.
[$The sun does not go around the earth.][@shortAnswer]
===
5. Dave believes in ghosts.
[$Dave does not believe in ghosts.][@shortAnswer]
===
6. Jane and Sue teach Spanish.
[$Jane and Sue don't teach Spanish.][@shortAnswer]
===
7. She flies to Sofia every April.
[$She does not fly to Sofia every April.][@shortAnswer]
===
8. The phone rings.
[$The phone does not ring.][@shortAnswer]
===
9. The banks close at 2 o'clock.
[$The banks do not close at 2 o'clock.][@shortAnswer]
===
10. Anne has lunch at home.
[$Anne does not have lunch at home.][@shortAnswer]
===

questions.question: 1. We are from Nigeria.
questions.sampleSolution: We are not from Nigeria.

questions.question: 2.They hate fish.
questions.sampleSolution: They do not hate fish.

questions.question: 3. She wants to become a superstar.
questions.sampleSolution: She does not want to become a superstar.

questions.question: 4.The sun goes around the earth.
questions.sampleSolution: The sun does not go around the earth.

questions.question: 5. Dave believes in ghosts.
questions.sampleSolution: Dave does not believe in ghosts.

questions.question: 6. Jane and Sue teach Spanish.
questions.sampleSolution: Jane and Sue don't teach Spanish.

questions.question: 7. She flies to Sofia every April.
questions.sampleSolution: She does not fly to Sofia every April.

questions.question: 8. The phone rings.
questions.sampleSolution: The phone does not ring.

questions.question: 9. The banks close at 2 o'clock.
questions.sampleSolution: The banks do not close at 2 o'clock.

questions.question: 10. Anne has lunch at home.
questions.sampleSolution: Anne does not have lunch at home.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:230949]
[!Setze die in Klammern stehenden Verben in die Lücken.]
[%Nr. 4464]

1. Ally [_cannot read][!can/not/to read] his handwriting.
2. I [_enjoy][!to enjoy] travelling.
3. David usually [_speaks][!to speak] French on the telephone.
4. They [_have][!to have] a nice garden.
5. Stan [_gathers][!to gather] Pat and Steve [_are][!to be] rather popular.
6. My aunt often [_jumps][!to jump] queues.
7. Water [_expands][!to expand] when it [_freezes][!to freeze].
8. She [_tries][!to try] to lose weight.
9. Hawaii [_is][!to be] in the Pacific Ocean.
10. We sometimes [_look][!to look] around the shops.

bit.body:
1. Ally {0} his handwriting.
2. I {1} travelling.
3. David usually {2} French on the telephone.
4. They {3} a nice garden.
5. Stan {4} Pat and Steve {5} rather popular.
6. My aunt often {6} queues.
7. Water {7} when it {8}.
8. She {9} to lose weight.
9. Hawaii {10} in the Pacific Ocean.
10. We sometimes {11} around the shops.
bit.instruction: Setze die in Klammern stehenden Verben in die Lücken.

bitmark:
[.multiple-response:bitmark--]
[@id:230950]
[%Nr. 4464]
[!Welche Antworten sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?]
[-just]
[+normally]
[+seldom]
[-two weeks ago]
[+usually]
[-yet]
===
[!2. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?]
[+she agrees]
[+she annoys]
[+she cries]
[-she hurrys]
[-she kissis]
[+she rushes]
[-she teachs]
[-she worrys]
===
[!3. Welche Handlungen kennzeichnen das Simple Present?]
[+allgemeine Aussagen]
[+feststehende Handlungen (auch Zukunft)]
[-Handlungen geschehen im Moment des Sprechens]
[-Handlungen haben in der Vergangenheit begonnen und dauern jetzt noch an]
[-Handlungen sind abgeschlossen]
[+Handlungsfolgen]
[+regelmäßige, wiederholte Handlungen]
===
[!4. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?]
[+Are you Greek?]
[+Do you have a brother?]
[-I don't usually have lunch at school.]
[-Martin has been to Montreal.]
[-Peggy was on holiday.]
[+The largest number of people lives in Brooklyn.]
[+We have two cars.]
===

quizzes.instruction: 1. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?
2. Welche Verbformen sind richtig gebildet?
3. Welche Handlungen kennzeichnen das Simple Present?

responses.response: Handlungen geschehen im Moment des Sprechens
Handlungen haben in der Vergangenheit begonnen und dauern jetzt noch an

quizzes.instruction: 4. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?

responses.response: I don't usually have lunch at school.
The largest number of people lives in Brooklyn.

bitmark:
[.interview:bitmark--]
[@id:230951]
[!Bilde Fragen]
[%Nr. 4464]
===
1. your parents / to wait up for you
[$Do your parents wait up for you?][@shortAnswer]
===
2. who / to help / Roger / in the shop (Wer hilft Roger im Laden?)
[$Who helps Roger in the shop?][@shortAnswer]
===
3. what / can / we / to do / to find / the stolen bike
[$What can we do to find the stolen bike?][@shortAnswer]
===
4. how / you / to feel
[$How do you feel?][@shortAnswer]
===
5. can / I / to get / you / a glass of water
[$Can I get you a glass of water?][@shortAnswer]
===
6. why / not to clean / you / your shoes
[$Why don't you clean your shoes?][@shortAnswer]
===
7. may / I / to come in
[$May I come in?][@shortAnswer]
===
8. who / to help / Roger / in the shop (Wem hilft Roger im Laden?)
[$Who does Roger help in the shop?][@shortAnswer]
===
9. you / to speak / any Roman language
[$Do you speak any Roman language?][@shortAnswer]
===
10. Pat / not to come / with us
[$Doesn't Pat come with us?][@shortAnswer]
===

questions.question: 1. your parents / to wait up for you
questions.sampleSolution: Do your parents wait up for you?

questions.question: 2. who / to help / Roger / in the shop (Wer hilft Roger im Laden?)
questions.sampleSolution: Who helps Roger in the shop?

questions.question: 3. what / can / we / to do / to find / the stolen bike
questions.sampleSolution: What can we do to find the stolen bike?

questions.question: 4. how / you / to feel
questions.sampleSolution: How do you feel?

questions.question: 5. can / I / to get / you / a glass of water
questions.sampleSolution: Can I get you a glass of water?

questions.question: 6. why / not to clean / you / your shoes
questions.sampleSolution: Why don't you clean your shoes?

questions.question: 7. may / I / to come in
questions.sampleSolution: May I come in?

questions.question: 8. who / to help / Roger / in the shop (Wem hilft Roger im Laden?)
questions.sampleSolution: Who does Roger help in the shop?

questions.question: 9. you / to speak / any Roman language
questions.sampleSolution: Do you speak any Roman language?

questions.question: 10. Pat / not to come / with us
questions.sampleSolution: Doesn't Pat come with us?

bitmark:
[.interview:bitmark--]
[@id:230952]
[!Schreibe die Sätze und benutze die Kurz- oder Langform, je nachdem was nicht dasteht.]
[%Nr. 4464]
===
1. You shouldn't eat so much meat.
[$You should not eat so much meat.][@shortAnswer]
===
2. We're late.
[$We are late.][@shortAnswer]
===
3. He isn't from Peking.
[$He is not from Peking.][@shortAnswer]
===
4. I'm not Spanish.
[$I am not Spanish.][@shortAnswer]
===
5. He cannot come with us.
[$He can't come with us.][@shortAnswer]
===
6. She does not like rice.
[$She doesn't like rice.][@shortAnswer]
===
7. That is a pity.
[$That's a pity.][@shortAnswer]
===
8. They don't walk to school.
[$They do not walk to school.][@shortAnswer]
===
9. They are in the attic.
[$They're in the attic.][@shortAnswer]
===
10. She need not come.
[$She needn't come.][@shortAnswer]
===

questions.question: 4. I'm not Spanish.
questions.sampleSolution: I am not Spanish.

questions.question: 5. He cannot come with us.
questions.sampleSolution: He can't come with us.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:230953]
[%Nr. 4464]
[!Setze die richtigen Verbformen ein.]

1. Tomorrow [+is][-are][-be][-am] Sunday.
2. He [+should][-schould] be at home by 10 o'clock.
3. I usually [+go][-goes][-gos] to bed at 11 o'clock.
4. She might [+arrive][-arrives][-arrivs] at Gatwick airport.
5. The museum [+doesn't][-does'nt][-dosn't][-don't] open on Mondays.
6. It [+may][-mays] rain later.
7. What time [+does][-dos][-do] the film begin?
8. The lesson [+starts][-start] at 8.30.
9. Anne and Peggy [-is][+are][-be][-am] too late.
10. They [+don't][-do'nt][-doesn't] wear school uniform.

bit.body:
1. Tomorrow {0} Sunday.
2. He {1} be at home by 10 o'clock.
3. I usually {2} to bed at 11 o'clock.
4. She might {3} at Gatwick airport.
5. The museum {4} open on Mondays.
6. It {5} rain later.
7. What time {6} the film begin?
8. The lesson {7} at 8.30.
9. Anne and Peggy {8} too late.
10. They {9} wear school uniform.

bitmark:
[.interview:bitmark--]
[@id:230954]
[!Frage nach den unterstrichenen Satzteilen.]
[%Nr.4464]
===
1. I like cycling __because it's fun.__
[$Why do you like cycling?][@shortAnswer]
===
2. Lisa talks about __Danny.__
[$Who does Lisa talk about?][@shortAnswer]
===
3. The child plays __the trumpet.__
[$What does the child play?][@shortAnswer]
===
4. Susan is __25 years old.__
[$How old is Susan?][@shortAnswer]
===
5. They usually go on holiday __in July.__
[$When do they usually go on holiday?][@shortAnswer]
===
6. Jerry comes __from Leeds.__
[$Where does Jerry come from?][@shortAnswer]
===
7. We write to __four__ pen friends.
[$How many pen friends do we write to?][@shortAnswer]
===
8. Mel works __in an office.__
[$Where does Mel work?][@shortAnswer]
===
9. He works __60__ hours a week.
[$How many hours a week does he work?][@shortAnswer]
===
10. __Pamela__ does not like squash.
[$Who does not like squash?][@shortAnswer]
===

questions.question: 1. I like cycling __because it's fun.__
questions.sampleSolution: Why do you like cycling?

questions.question: 2. Lisa talks about __Danny.__
questions.sampleSolution: Who does Lisa talk about?

questions.question: 3. The child plays __the trumpet.__
questions.sampleSolution: What does the child play?

questions.question: 4. Susan is __25 years old.__
questions.sampleSolution: How old is Susan?

questions.question: 5. They usually go on holiday __in July.__
questions.sampleSolution: When do they usually go on holiday?

questions.question: 6. Jerry comes __from Leeds.__
questions.sampleSolution: Where does Jerry come from?

questions.question: 7. We write to __four__ pen friends.
questions.sampleSolution: How many pen friends do we write to?

questions.question: 8. Mel works __in an office.__
questions.sampleSolution: Where does Mel work?

questions.question: 9. He works __60__ hours a week.
questions.sampleSolution: How many hours a week does he work?

questions.question: 10. __Pamela__ does not like squash.
questions.sampleSolution: Who does not like squash?

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:230955]
[%Nr. 4465]
[!Setze die in Klammern stehenden Verben in die Lücken.]

1. Look! The boys [_are running][!to run] to the playground.
2. Tom never [_writes][!to write] picture postcards.
3. We [_are playing][!to play] a computer game at the moment.
4. Pat often [_goes][!to go] to concerts.
5. Listen! Anne and Susan [_are singing][!to sing] a song.
6. I [_am watching][!to watch] a nice film now.
7. Angela sometimes [_visits][!to visit] a museum.
8. They [_are][!to be] from Tokyo.
9. The cat seldom [_sleeps][!to sleep] on the sofa.
10. Every afternoon Jack [_has][!to have] a cup of tea.

bit.body:
1. Look! The boys {0} to the playground.
2. Tom never {1} picture postcards.
3. We {2} a computer game at the moment.
4. Pat often {3} to concerts.
5. Listen! Anne and Susan {4} a song.
6. I {5} a nice film now.
7. Angela sometimes {6} a museum.
8. They {7} from Tokyo.
9. The cat seldom {8} on the sofa.
10. Every afternoon Jack {9} a cup of tea.
bit.instruction: Setze die in Klammern stehenden Verben in die Lücken.

bitmark:
[.multiple-response:bitmark--]
[@id:230957]
[%Nr. 4465]
[!Welche Antworten sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?]
[+Do you like tea?]
[+He is British.]
[-She dropped a glass of milk.]
[-She is sitting on a chair.]
[+We don't go by bus.]
===
[!2. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Present Progressive?]
[-He does not make the beds.]
[-I often take photos.]
[+Is the cat playing in the garden?]
[+She's doing her homework.]
[+They are not cleaning their room.]
[-We have a new car.]
===
[!3. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Present Progressive?]
[+at the moment]
[-every day]
[+Listen!]
[+now]
[-often]
[-sometimes]
===
[!4. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?]
[-at the moment]
[+every day]
[-now]
[+often]
[+sometimes]
[-yesterday]
===
[!5. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Simple Present?]
[-are + Infinitiv + -ing]
[+Infinitiv]
[-Infinitiv + -ed]
[-Infinitiv + -ing]
[+Infinitiv + -s]
===
[!6. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Present Progressive?]
[+am + Infinitiv + -ing]
[+are + Infinitiv + -ing]
[-Infinitiv]
[-Infinitiv + -ing]
[+is + Infinitiv + -ing]
[+to be + Infinitiv + -ing]
===

quizzes.instruction: 1. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?

responses.response: She dropped a glass of milk.
She is sitting on a chair.

quizzes.instruction: 2. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Present Progressive?

responses.response: He does not make the beds.
Is the cat playing in the garden?
They are not cleaning their room.

quizzes.instruction: 3. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Present Progressive?
4. Was sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?
5. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Simple Present?
6. Welche Verbformen kennzeichnen das Present Progressive?

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:230958]
[%Nr. 4465]
[!Welche Zeitform wird bei folgenden Handlungen verwendet?]
===
[!1. allgemeine Aussagen]
[-Present Progressive]
[+Simple Present]
===
[!2. Handlungsfolgen in der Gegenwart]
[-Present Progressive]
[+Simple Present]
===
[!3. regelmäßig wiederholte Handlungen]
[-Present Progressive]
[+Simple Present]
===
[!4. gewohnheitsmäßige Handlungen]
[-Present Progressive]
[+Simple Present]
===
[!5. Handlungen geschehen im Moment des Sprechens]
[+Present Progressive]
[-Simple Present]
===

bit.instruction: Welche Zeitform wird bei folgenden Handlungen verwendet?

quizzes.instruction: 1. allgemeine Aussagen
2. Handlungsfolgen in der Gegenwart
3. regelmäßig wiederholte Handlungen
4. gewohnheitsmäßige Handlungen
5. Handlungen geschehen im Moment des Sprechens

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:230959]
[%Nr. 4465]
[!Signalwörter in Sätzen – Welcher Satz ist richtig?]
===
[!1.]
[+Timmy is asking a lot of questions now.]
[-Timmy is sometimes asking a lot of questions.]
===
[!2.]
[+Every afternoon mum makes a cup of tea.]
[-Listen! Mum makes a cup of tea.]
===
[!3.]
[+He often reads a book.]
[-He reads a book now.]
===
[!4.]
[-Listen! We play the drums.]
[+We never play the drums.]
===
[!5.]
[+Dorothy helps with the cooking in the afternoons.]
[-Look! Dorothy helps with the cooking.]
===
[!6.]
[-Every day the boy is making a snowball.]
[+Look! The boy is making a snowball.]
===
[!7.]
[-Andy repairs things at the moment.]
[+Andy sometimes repairs things.]
===
[!8.]
[+They always go to school by bus.]
[-They go to school by bus at the moment.]
===
[!9.]
[+Look! Stan is doing magic tricks.]
[-Stan is usually doing magic tricks.]
===
[!10.]
[+Listen! The girls are making a lot of noise.]
[-The girls are often making a lot of noise.]
===

bit.instruction: Signalwörter in Sätzen – Welcher Satz ist richtig?

choices.choice: Timmy is asking a lot of questions now.
Timmy is sometimes asking a lot of questions.
Every afternoon mum makes a cup of tea.
Listen! Mum makes a cup of tea.
Dorothy helps with the cooking in the afternoons.
Look! Dorothy helps with the cooking.
Every day the boy is making a snowball.
Look! The boy is making a snowball.
Andy repairs things at the moment.
They always go to school by bus.
They go to school by bus at the moment.
Look! Stan is doing magic tricks.
Stan is usually doing magic tricks.
Listen! The girls are making a lot of noise.
The girls are often making a lot of noise.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:230960]
[%Nr. 4465]
[!Setze die richtigen Verbformen ein.]

1. Sandy often [+forgets][-forget] her homework.
2. Pat [+drives][-drive] a school bus.
3. Anne and Tom [+are][-am][-be][-is] feeding the cows.
4. I [-are][+am][-be][-is] from New Zealand.
5. I [-are][+am][-be][-is] preparing dinner.
6. [+Do][-Does] they walk to school?
7. The baby [-are][-am][-be][+is] crying.
8. Andy [+is][-are][-am] washing his pullover.
9. We [+are][-am][-be][-is] drawing a picture.
10. Our friend sometimes [+goes][-go]to the supermarket.

bit.body:
1. Sandy often {0} her homework.
2. Pat {1} a school bus.
3. Anne and Tom {2} feeding the cows.
4. I {3} from New Zealand.
5. I {4} preparing dinner.
6. {5} they walk to school?
7. The baby {6} crying.
8. Andy {7} washing his pullover.
9. We {8} drawing a picture.
10. Our friend sometimes {9}to the supermarket.

bitmark:
[.multiple-response:bitmark--]
[@id:230961]
[%Nr. 4468]
[!Welche Antworten sind richtig?]
===
[!1. Welches sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?]
[-already]
[-at the moment]
[+every day]
[-last week]
[+normally]
[-now]
[+seldom]
[+usually]
===
[!2. Welches sind typische Signalwörter für das Present Progressive?]
[-ago]
[+at the moment]
[-just]
[+Listen!]
[+Look!]
[-never]
[+now]
[-yet]
===
[!3. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?]
[-Anne is always coming late.]
[+First I get up then I have breakfast.]
[-He's just finished the letter.]
[+I'm here.]
[-I was having breakfast.]
[+She lives in Sofia.]
===
[!4. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Present Progressive?]
[+He's having a shower.]
[-He had a shower in the morning.]
[-He often has a shower in the morning.]
[-He was sitting on the beach.]
[+We're thinking of buying a new car.]
===

quizzes.instruction: 1. Welches sind typische Signalwörter für das Simple Present?
2. Welches sind typische Signalwörter für das Present Progressive?
3. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Simple Present?

responses.response: First I get up then I have breakfast.

quizzes.instruction: 4. Welche Sätze/Fragen stehen im Present Progressive?

responses.response: He had a shower in the morning.
He often has a shower in the morning.
He was sitting on the beach.
We're thinking of buying a new car.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:230962]
[%Nr. 4468]
[!Setze die richtigen Verbformen ein.]

1. He [+is living][-lives] with his grandmother until his mother comes back from China.
2. I have to go now. [+It's getting][-It gets] dark.
3. Hey John! [+Are you thinking][-Do you think] about Peggy?
4. I [+think][-am thinking] his brother is football-crazy.
5. My father [+prefers][-is prefering] tea for breakfast.
6. This cake [+tastes][-is tasting] wonderful.
7. He [+is reading][-reads] the newspaper at the moment.
8. We [+hear][-are hearing] music in the street.
9. [+Does your little brother believe][-Is your little brother believing] in ghosts?
10. [+I agree][-I am agreeing] with you.

bit.body:
1. He {0} with his grandmother until his mother comes back from China.
2. I have to go now. {1} dark.
3. Hey John! {2} about Peggy?
4. I {3} his brother is football-crazy.
5. My father {4} tea for breakfast.
6. This cake {5} wonderful.
7. He {6} the newspaper at the moment.
8. We {7} music in the street.
9. {8} in ghosts?
10. {9} with you.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:230963]
[%Nr. 4468]
[!Welche Handlungen stehen in welcher Zeitform?]
===
[!1. Welche der folgenden Handlungen steht im Simple Present?]
[-Handlung geschieht im Moment des Sprechens]
[-Handlung ist in der Vergangenheit abgeschlossen]
[+regelmäßig wiederholte Handlung]
===
[!2. Welche der folgenden Handlungen steht im Simple Present?]
[-Handlung begann in der Vergangenheit und dauert bis in die Gegenwart an]
[+Handlungsfolgen in der Gegenwart]
[-Plan in der Zukunft]
===
[!3. Welche der folgenden Handlungen steht im Present Progressive?]
[+Handlung geschieht im Moment des Sprechens]
[-Handlung wurde gerade abgeschlossen]
[-regelmäßig wiederholte Handlung]
===
[!4. Welche der folgenden Handlungen steht im Simple Present?]
[+allgemeine Aussage]
[-feststehender Plan in der Zukunft]
[-Resultat einer Handlung ist wichtig]
===
[!5. Welche der folgenden Handlungen steht im Present Progressive?]
[+Handlungen, die nur vorübergehend stattfinden]
[-Handlungsfolgen in der Gegenwart]
[-Resultat einer Handlung ist wichtig]
===
[!6. Welche der folgenden Handlungen steht im Simple Present?]
[+feststehende Handlung (auch in der Zukunft, z.B. Fahrplan)]
[-Handlung fand gerade statt, als ein neues Ereignis eintrat]
[-spontane Handlung in der Zukunft]
===
[!7. Welche der folgenden Handlungen steht im Present Progressive?]
[-allgemeine Aussage]
[-spontane Handlung in der Zukunft]
[+zukünftige Handlung ist fest geplant]
===

bit.instruction: Welche Handlungen stehen in welcher Zeitform?

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:230964]
[%Nr. 4468]
[!Setze die Verben entweder im Simple Present oder im Present Progressive ein.]

1. Anne [_has][!to have] red hair.
2. My history teacher [_talks][!to talk] too much.
3. Listen! They [_are coming][!to come] home.
4. The bus to New York [_leaves][!to leave] at 6.30.
5. Right now Christine [_is working][!to work] on the computer.
6. Hey! What [_are][!to be] you [_doing][!to do] there?
7. I usually [_work][!to work] as a teacher in Germany, but this summer I [_am working][!to work] as a language assistant in Rome.
8. John often [_takes][!to take] sugar in his coffee.
9. The flowers [_smell][!to smell] beautiful.
10. I [_am][!to be] thirsty.

bit.body:
1. Anne {0} red hair.
2. My history teacher {1} too much.
3. Listen! They {2} home.
4. The bus to New York {3} at 6.30.
5. Right now Christine {4} on the computer.
6. Hey! What {5} you {6} there?
7. I usually {7} as a teacher in Germany, but this summer I {8} as a language assistant in Rome.
8. John often {9} sugar in his coffee.
9. The flowers {10} beautiful.
10. I {11} thirsty.

bitmark:
[.interview:bitmark--]
[@id:230965]
[%Nr. 4468]
[!Verneine die vorgegebenen Sätze.]
===
1. I like fish.
[$I do not like fish.][@shortAnswer]
===
2. She is good at sports.
[$She is not good at sports.][@shortAnswer]
===
3. He is waiting for the bus.
[$He is not waiting for the bus.][@shortAnswer]
===
4. Anne is smiling.
[$Anne is not smiling.][@shortAnswer]
===
5. They are using a dictionary.
[$They are not using a dictionary.][@shortAnswer]
===
6. We are carrying a big box.
[$We are not carrying a big box.][@shortAnswer]
===
7. Stacey works in the library.
[$Stacey does not work in the library.][@shortAnswer]
===
8. My friend lives in Stockholm.
[$My friend does not live in Stockholm.][@shortAnswer]
===
9. The diary is lying on the floor.
[$The diary is not lying on the floor.][@shortAnswer]
===
10. They are preparing the picnic.
[$They are not preparing the picnic.][@shortAnswer]
===

bitmark:
[.multiple-response:bitmark--]
[@id:230966]
[%Nr. 4468]
[!Welcher Satz ist oder welche Sätze sind richtig?]
===
[!1.]
[+I love holidays.]
[+I'm loving every minute of my holiday.]
===
[!2.]
[+You are silly.]
[+You are being very silly about this.]
===
[!3.]
[+She weighs 60 kilos.]
[+She is weighing the turkey.]
===
[!4.]
[+I think we should go.]
[-I am thinking we should go.]
===
[!5.]
[+The soup tastes good.]
[+I am tasting the soup.]
===
[!6.]
[+I feel fine.]
[+I'm feeling fine.]
===
[!7.]
[+I remember my first day at school.]
[-I am remembering my first date.]
===
[!8.]
[+I need a new computer.]
[-I am needing an umbrella now.]
===
[!9.]
[+I see what the teacher means.]
[-I'm seeing what the teacher means.]
===

bit.instruction: Welcher Satz ist oder welche Sätze sind richtig?

responses.response: I'm loving every minute of my holiday.
You are being very silly about this.
I am thinking we should go.
I remember my first day at school.
I am remembering my first date.
I am needing an umbrella now.
I see what the teacher means.
I'm seeing what the teacher means.
